transcripts.text: You're watching one of a series of videos where Elisa Childers and I respond to 23 progressive Christian claims, kind of like a progressive Christian manifesto that was written by Ragamuffin TV.  We deal with these claims, some good, some bad, some ugly, and I'm hoping that this helps you to think biblically.
Let's move on to number three.  This one should be pretty easy.  Number three, it's not a sin to not vote Republican.
Done.  We'll give you that one.

Yeah, I don't know.  Well, I think it comes from that kind of caricature that people have of what you might call conservative Christians is that if – when you – put your saving faith in Jesus Christ, you get a MAGA hat and you get a gun locker and all this, and that goes together.  I mean, I have wonderful Christian friends who have very strong political opinions, but I don't know any who tie that together with the gospel.  They're voting in a way that they think is the most biblical and that they believe is... And we all do that.  We're all voting in the way that we believe is going to Because all laws legislate morality.  We want to legislate as best we can what we think God would have for people.  But yeah, I think it's a bit of a caricature and maybe a bit of a straw man.

Yeah, and it's also a setup.  For what they're really interested in, which is in number four.  Number four gets you what they really care about.  This isn't about parties.  Yes.  This is ultimately about issues.  That's right.  And here's the issue they care about.
